snippet: The federal Election Assistance Commission had denied requests from Kansas and Arizona to add proof-of-citizenship instructions to registration forms.
abstract: Federal Judge Eric F Melgren rules that the federal Election Assistance Commission had no legal authority to deny requests from Kansas and Arizona to add proof of citizenship to a national registration form; decision represents triumph for conservatives who say requirement will deter voter fraud by noncitizens, and is a setback for those who argue it will disenfranchise legitimate minority voters; decision could well set trend for other Republican-dominated states.
lead_paragraph: The federal Election Assistance Commission had denied requests from Kansas and Arizona to add proof-of-citizenship instructions to registration forms.

headline.main: Two States Win Court Approval on Voter Rules
headline.print_headline: Two States Win Court Approval on Voter Rules
